Riot API Libraries¶

C#¶

Camille (☆ 7)¶

Fully rate limited, automatic retrying, thread-safe. V4 Supported. Automatic nightly releases.

Links¶

  • NuGet
License: LGPL-3.0
Tags: v3, v4, rate-limiting
Last Updated: Feb 19, 2019

RiotNet (☆ 18)¶

A .NET/C# client for the Riot Games API

Links¶

  • NuGet
  • Documentation
License: MIT
Tags: v3, rate-limiting
Last Updated: Jan 27, 2019

CottontailSummoners (☆ 0)¶

LeagueOfLegends v3 API wrapper. Website in asp.net MVC like www.op.gg

Links¶

  • NuGet
License: MIT
Tags: v3, rate-limiter
Last Updated: Mar 1, 2018

Last Updated: Feb 9, 2019

riot-lol-api (☆ 11)¶

A library tuned to handle with very high volumes of requests to the API (over 1k requests per seconds) over one or many instances

Links¶

  • npm
License: MIT
Tags: v3, rate-limiting, burst, high-usage
Last Updated: Feb 8, 2019

TeemoJS (☆ 7)¶

Fast & tiny, automatic retries & smart rate limiting, V4 & champion.gg support, all in 300 lines.

Links¶

  • npm
License: LGPL-3.0
Tags: v3, v4, rate-limiting
Last Updated: Jan 24, 2019

RiotRateLimiter-node (☆ 5)¶

A rate limiter for node-js handling rate-limits enforced by the riot-games api

Links¶

  • npm
License: MIT
Tags: v3, rate-limiting, header-driven, burst, spread, per-region
Last Updated: Jan 4, 2019

Kotlin¶

riot-api-android (☆ 1)¶

A library to use riot api and datadragon with android. It uses Retrofit and Picasso.

Links¶

  • Github
  • Documentation
  • Library (.aar)
License: MIT
Tags: v3, datadragon, android, caching
Last Updated: Apr 18, 2018

License: GPL-3.0

Last Updated: Feb 6, 2019

league-api (☆ 0)¶

League API is a PHP wrapper of RIOT Games’ League of Legends API. This wrapper gives you access to both REST API and Data Dragon in an eloquent way that you’ll love!

Links¶

License: MIT
Tags: v3
Last Updated: Nov 26, 2018

LeagueWrap (☆ 6)¶

League of Legend API wrapper for PHP 5.6 and 7+. Supports PSR-6 compatible caching backends and rate-limiting, as well as batch requests.

Links¶

  • Github
  • Packagist
License: MIT
Tags: v3, rate-limiting
Last Updated: Mar 2, 2018
